function_call.name: eval_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":["Global spread of contagious diseases like covid-19 in cities","Transmission of contagious diseases within the community radio station and podcast production environment.","Spread of contagious diseases through close contact during podcast interviews and broadcasting activities.","Risks associated with international travel and interaction with global urban academics and professionals.","Inclusion of multiple voices and perspectives in the commentary may lead to the propagation of conflicting information about covid-19.","International mobility of scholars increases the risk of spreading contagious diseases across borders.","Rapid production and dissemination of the podcast project may amplify awareness of the impact of the covid-19 pandemic on cities, but may also spread misinformation or panic.","Iterative collaboration and sharing of the critical commentary may facilitate the exchange of ideas and insights but also increase the risk of exposure to the virus during in-person discussions or gatherings.","Prevalence of depression and ptsd among quarantined people during the covid-19 outbreak","Burden of the pandemic and prevalence of mental health problems","Prevalence of symptoms of anxiety, depression, and trauma related to covid-19","Vulnerability of certain groups to mental health disturbances during the covid-19 pandemic.","Reliance on unreliable or overwhelming information sources for pandemic-related information dissemination.","Prevalence of psychological problems and associated factors during the covid-19 pandemic.","Spread of the novel coronavirus","Dynamic evolution of the pandemic","Rapid rollout of digital tools and packages in the medtech sector.","Switch from in-person to remote consultation methods in healthcare.","Rapid navigation of governance and digital integration for digital care processes.","Rapid education of healthcare workforce leading to potential gaps in knowledge and skills","Use of digital health solutions for rapid redeployment education","Rapid development and implementation of new models of care supported by digital health innovation","Increased interaction and communication through social media platforms can lead to the rapid spread of misinformation about contagious diseases and their prevention.","The cancellation of educational activities, such as conferences and training courses, reduces opportunities for healthcare professionals to learn about new developments in disease prevention, diagnosis, and treatment.","Highly infective disease with a range of symptoms, including respiratory failure or death","Need to triage and treat large numbers of patients with respiratory illness","Need to protect the healthcare workforce to ensure they are able to treat the sick","Cross-border movement of academics and professionals leading to potential spread of contagious diseases","Financial interventions leading to economic instability and inequality","Lack of timely and accurate information leading to misinformation and panic","Global financial system volatility due to contagious epidemic","Potential risk of spreading contagious diseases among the 150,000 people detected in the Oxford town centre due to close proximity","Risks associated with viewpoint-independent human classification algorithm that may lead to overlooking potential health risks and disease transmission patterns","Public sharing of materials and sample videos may lead to misuse of technology for covert surveillance or unethical monitoring practices","Use of ai and computer vision technology for social distancing monitoring","Utilization of human detector model for monitoring public spaces","Accumulating approach to highlighting risky zones in covered areas with poor ventilation","Inaccurate risk assessment due to varying contamination trends in different areas","Inadequate long-term monitoring of crowd behavior and contamination trends","Risk of increased density of contamination in covered places with minimal ventilation due to static people","Risk of high traffic areas showing stronger contamination heatmaps","Risk of social distancing violations leading to high-risk categories of individuals","Collection and tracking of individual movement data","Identification of high-risk zones and creation of risk heat-map","Use of environmental noise for visualization of heat-map","Identifying couples based on proximity and time could lead to inaccurate assumptions about their actual relationship, potentially missing true social contacts or interactions.","Enforcement of proximity-based social distancing measures may result in privacy concerns and resistance from individuals.","Reliance on technology for identifying social distancing violations may lead to errors in detection and interpretation of human behaviors.","Lack of consensus on social distancing guidelines for family members and couples","Inaccurate measurement of inter-people distance due to controversial opinions","Unrecognized social distancing violations in risky zones","Detection of people with partial visibility or truncated objects","Challenges in extreme lighting conditions and lens distortion effects","Social distancing violation due to inaccurate distance measurements","Mass deployment of the system in large shopping malls","Use of real-time performance hardware with low accuracy in social distancing monitoring","Failure of social distancing monitoring models with low speed","Frequent cases of occlusions, overlaps, and crowded zones in the dataset","Unequal condition for speed and generalisability testing on the otc dataset","Benchmarking tests and comparisons conducted on a single hardware and software platform","Training on a large number of samples from the google open images dataset, including human body parts, increases the risk of model overfitting to specific characteristics of that dataset and may not generalize well to other datasets.","Utilizing a transfer learning approach with pre-trained models may introduce biases and assumptions from the source dataset microsoft coco into the human detection model, leading to biased predictions and potential fairness issues.","Using stochastic gradient descent sgd with warm restarts and a cosine annealing learning rate schedule may lead to challenges in hyperparameter tuning and model convergence, as well as the need for careful adjustment of learning rate values.","Use of multi-scale detection techniques may increase computational resource requirements","Inefficient spatial pooling operations may impact the accuracy and efficiency of the model","Use of selective search and region proposal for two-stage detectors may introduce potential biases in object detection","Potential difficulty in dealing with low-resolution images","Challenges in detecting small objects in images","Loss of local information during feature extraction process","Presence of extra layers between the backbone and the head neck module may introduce additional complexity and potential points of failure in the model.","Selection of a backbone architecture with a higher number of parameters may lead to increased complexity and resource requirements.","Use of data augmentation techniques such as mosaic may create a false sense of data variety and lead to overfitting if not used carefully","Noisy estimation of mean and variance in batch normalization due to batch size reduction","Selection and evaluation of activation functions may result in suboptimal model performance","Integration of the system on all types of cctv surveillance cameras","Reliance on large training datasets for people detection","Inherent limitations of object detection models and algorithms","Limited research on accuracy of people detection and inter-people distance estimation in crowds","Lack of standard comparison on common datasets for people detection and distance estimation","No analytical studies or post-processing to analyze the risk of infection distribution after people detection","Lack of statistical analysis provided for the outcome of the distance violation index","No statistical assessment on virus spread based on distance measurements","Inaccurate comparison of dnn models' accuracy based on non-comparable ground truths","Use of gps data for monitoring infected individuals may raise privacy concerns and potential misuse of personal data.","Use of ai and machine learning to monitor public spaces may lead to increased reliance on surveillance and raise ethical concerns about privacy and consent.","Challenges in implementing wireless signal-based human detection in public places may lead to ineffectiveness of the technology and reliance on alternative monitoring methods."]}
